hypothesis_content.title: Post-CPI Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a major macro catalyst (CPI release) that causes a sharp intraday whipsaw (>5% BTC move) but closes within ±1.5% of pre-release price, the subsequent 24-48 hours will see a directional breakout that continues the initial post-CPI move direction, amplified by trapped liquidity from the whipsaw.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Major catalysts create liquidity traps as stops get hit during whipsaws. When price returns to origin, weak hands exit while strong hands accumulate. The subsequent move exploits the reduced liquidity on one side of the market. Recent CPI events show this pattern with December's $23B options expiry creating additional gamma exposure.
entry_conditions: BTC experiences >5% intraday range during CPI release window (8:30-10:30 ET)
BTC closes within ±1.5% of pre-CPI price (measured 30min before release)
BTC 4-hour RSI(14) crosses above 60 (bullish) or below 40 (bearish) in direction of initial post-CPI spike

exit_conditions.take_profit: 2.8x the initial post-CPI spike magnitude (measured from pre-CPI price to intraday extreme)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 1.2x the initial post-CPI spike magnitude in opposite direction

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to materialize within 48 hours OR price reverses through the initial spike extreme (>100% retracement) more than 60% of tested occurrences.
